user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 17.8 is: A function parameter should not be modified.
Note that the object referred to by a pointer parameter may be modified, but the pointer itself shall not be modified.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of _metal_irq_set_enable:
```c
static void _metal_irq_set_enable(int irq, unsigned int state)
{
	struct metal_irq_controller *cntr;

	cntr = metal_irq_get_controller(irq);
	if (cntr == NULL) {
		return;
	}
	cntr->irq_set_enable(cntr, irq, state);
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function _metal_irq_set_enable:
struct metal_irq_controller {
	int irq_base; /**< Start of IRQ number of the range managed by
		 	* the IRQ controller
		 	*/
	int irq_num; /**< Number of IRQs managed by the IRQ controller */
	void *arg; /**< Argument to pass to interrupt controller function */
	metal_irq_set_enable irq_set_enable; /**< function to set IRQ enable */
	metal_cntr_irq_register irq_register; /**< function to register IRQ
						* handler
						*/
	struct metal_list node; /**< list node */
	struct metal_irq *irqs; /**< Array of IRQs managed by the controller */
}
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags: static void _metal_irq_set_enable(int irq, unsigned int state)
metal_irq_set_enable irq_set_enable; /**< function to set IRQ enable */
explanation: No other code fragments modify any function parameters. Inside _metal_irq_set_enable the parameters irq and state are only passed (by value) and never assigned to; cntr is a local variable initialized from metal_irq_get_controller and its assignment does not modify any function parameter. The null check and return do not alter parameters. The remaining struct members are declarations (data members), not function parameters being modified. Therefore there are no other fragments in the provided code that warrant investigation under Rule 17.8.
